Class shape.MultiResult 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----shape.MultiResult
public class MultiResult
extends Object
implements ResultProtocol, Globals, Serializable
for shapes whose fate depends on the number of outside liberties, we store a "MultiResult" which contains an array of "SingleResults", each SingleResult corresponds to the results for some range of liberties.

MultiResult(LList)
create a multiresult from a LList derived from the original lisp list representation for a list of results.

return true of this MultiResult is equal to some other multiresult.

Fate_for_N_Liberties(int)
return the single result appropriate for a specified number of liberties of the principle surrounding group

return the maximum number of liberties for any result in the group, which is the largest number of liberties for which the result has been tested

MultiResult 
 private MultiResult(LList x)
create a multiresult from a LList derived from the original lisp list representation for a list of results. This is the raw constructor which doesn't attempt to hash-n-cache the result

N_Adjacent_Groups 
 public final int N_Adjacent_Groups()
return the number of adjacent groups of the surrounding color which should be found. If more are found, then the principle group isn't simply connected, and the result is not completely applicable. This information ought to be the same for all elements of the SingeResult list

Fate_for_N_Liberties 
 public final SingleResult Fate_for_N_Liberties(int n)
return the single result appropriate for a specified number of liberties of the principle surrounding group

Min_Liberties 
 public final int Min_Liberties()
return the minimum number of liberties for any result in the group

Max_Liberties 
 public final int Max_Liberties()
return the maximum number of liberties for any result in the group, which is the largest number of liberties for which the result has been tested
